title: Lynda- Designing with Grids in InDesign
description:
Designing with Grids in InDesign

2h 5m Intermediate Oct 23, 2013

Take the guesswork out of your InDesign layouts. Whether it's a business card, a poster, or a book, your design will look better if you use a grid. Join designer Nigel French as he takes you through a brief history of gridsÃ¢â‚¬â€why you should use them and when you should break them. He'll show you how to establish margins and columns, set up a layout grid, and how to fit text to a baseline grid. Plus, learn how to break the grid for graphic effect and experiment with different types of grids like 5- or 7-column layouts and radial grids.
Topics include:

    Why grids matter
    Determining your page size
    Creating margins and defining your type area
    Setting up a baseline grid
    Understanding the power of InDesign's Gridify feature
    Breaking your grid with images
    Maximizing white space with a grid
